tool_description: Create a simple app that makes requests to the Gmail API in just 5 to 10 minutes.
name: Gmail
title: Gmail

api_list.name: batchLabelsModify
api_list.description: Modifies the labels on the specified messages.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optional_parameters.name: addLabelIds
optional_parameters.description: Labels to add

optional_parameters.name: removeLabelIds
optional_parameters.description: Labels to remove

api_list.name: batchMessageDelete

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

api_list.name: createFilter

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optional_parameters.name: hasAttachment
optional_parameters.description: Whether the message has any attachment.

optional_parameters.name: sizeComparison
optional_parameters.description: How the message size in bytes should be in relation to the size field.

optional_parameters.name: to
optional_parameters.description: The recipient's display name or email address. Includes recipients in the "to", "cc", and "bcc" header fields. You can use simply the local part of the email address. For example, "example" and "example@" both match "example@gmail.com". This field is case-insensitive.

optional_parameters.name: excludeChats
optional_parameters.description: Whether the response should exclude chats.

optional_parameters.name: query
optional_parameters.description: Only return messages matching the specified query. Supports the same query format as the Gmail search box. For example, "from:someuser@example.com rfc822msgid: is:unread".

optional_parameters.name: size
optional_parameters.description: The size of the entire RFC822 message in bytes, including all headers and attachments.

optional_parameters.name: subject
optional_parameters.description: Case-insensitive phrase found in the message's subject. Trailing and leading whitespace are be trimmed and adjacent spaces are collapsed.

optional_parameters.name: negatedQuery
optional_parameters.description: Only return messages not matching the specified query. Supports the same query format as the Gmail search box. For example, "from:someuser@example.com rfc822msgid: is:unread".

optional_parameters.name: forward
optional_parameters.description: Email address that the message should be forwarded to.

optional_parameters.name: from
optional_parameters.description: The sender's display name or email address.

optional_parameters.name: addLabelIds
optional_parameters.description: Labels to add

optional_parameters.name: removeLabelIds
optional_parameters.description: Labels to remove

api_list.name: createForwardingAddress

required_parameters.name: forwardingEmail
required_parameters.description: The forwarding address to be set.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

api_list.name: createLabel

required_parameters.name: labelName
required_parameters.description: The display name of the label.

optional_parameters.name: messageListVisibility
optional_parameters.description: The visibility of messages with this label in the message list in the Gmail web interface.

optional_parameters.name: labelListVisibility
optional_parameters.description: The visibility of the label in the label list in the Gmail web interface.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

api_list.name: createRawDraft

required_parameters.name: message
required_parameters.description:
The entire draft message in an RFC 2822 formatted. Example: To: <someone@gmail.com>
Subject: Failure Notice

 Hi. This is the mail transport agent at mail.elsewhere.com.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

api_list.name: createSendAsAlias

required_parameters.name: port
required_parameters.description: The port of the SMTP service.

required_parameters.name: host
required_parameters.description: The hostname of the SMTP service.

required_parameters.name: securityMode
required_parameters.description: The protocol that will be used to secure communication with the SMTP service.

required_parameters.name: sendAsEmail
required_parameters.description: An optional email address that is included in a "Reply-To:" header for mail sent using this alias. If this is empty, Gmail will not generate a "Reply-To:" header.

required_parameters.name: treatAsAlias
required_parameters.description: Whether Gmail should treat this address as an alias for the user's primary email address. This setting only applies to custom "from" aliases.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optional_parameters.name: replyToAddress
optional_parameters.description: An optional email address that is included in a "Reply-To:" header for mail sent using this alias. If this is empty, Gmail will not generate a "Reply-To:" header.

optional_parameters.name: displayName
optional_parameters.description: A name that appears in the "From:" header for mail sent using this alias. For custom "from" addresses, when this is empty, Gmail will populate the "From:" header with the name that is used for the primary address associated with the account.

optional_parameters.name: username
optional_parameters.description: The username that will be used for authentication with the SMTP service.

optional_parameters.name: password
optional_parameters.description: The password that will be used for authentication with the SMTP service.

optional_parameters.name: signature
optional_parameters.description: An optional HTML signature that is included in messages composed with this alias in the Gmail web UI.

optional_parameters.name: isDefault
optional_parameters.description: Whether this address is selected as the default

api_list.name: getMailboxHistory
api_list.description: Lists the history of all changes to the given mailbox. History results are returned in chronological order (increasing historyId)

required_parameters.name: startHistoryId
required_parameters.description: Returns history records after the specified startHistoryId.

optional_parameters.name: maxResults
optional_parameters.description: The maximum number of history records to return.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optional_parameters.name: pageToken
optional_parameters.description: Page token to retrieve a specific page of results in the list.

optional_parameters.name: labelId
optional_parameters.description: Only return messages with a label matching the ID.

optional_parameters.name: historyTypes
optional_parameters.description: The immutable ID for the SmimeInfo.

api_list.name: getMailboxMessages
api_list.description: Lists the messages in the user's mailbox

optional_parameters.name: pageToken
optional_parameters.description: Page token to retrieve a specific page of results in the list.

optional_parameters.name: includeSpamTrash
optional_parameters.description: Include messages from SPAM and TRASH in the results

optional_parameters.name: q
optional_parameters.description: Only return messages matching the specified query. Supports the same query format as the Gmail search box. For example, "from:someuser@example.com rfc822msgid: is:unread".

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optional_parameters.name: maxResults
optional_parameters.description: Maximum number of messages to return.

optional_parameters.name: labelIds
optional_parameters.description: Only return messages with labels that match all of the specified label IDs.

api_list.name: getThreads
api_list.description: Lists the threads in the user's mailbox

optional_parameters.name: maxResults
optional_parameters.description: Maximum number of messages to return.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optional_parameters.name: q
optional_parameters.description: Only return messages matching the specified query. Supports the same query format as the Gmail search box. For example, "from:someuser@example.com rfc822msgid: is:unread".

optional_parameters.name: pageToken
optional_parameters.description: Page token to retrieve a specific page of results in the list.

optional_parameters.name: includeSpamTrash
optional_parameters.description: Include threads from SPAM and TRASH in the results

optional_parameters.description: Only return threads with labels that match all of the specified label IDs.

api_list.name: getVacationSettings

api_list.name: importMessageIntoMailbox
api_list.description: Imports a message into only this user's mailbox, with standard email delivery scanning and classification similar to receiving via SMTP. Does not send a message.

required_parameters.name: raw
required_parameters.description:
The entire draft message in an RFC 2822 formatted. Example: To: <someone@gmail.com>
Subject: Failure Notice

 Hi. This is the mail transport agent at mail.elsewhere.com.

optional_parameters.name: internalDateSource
optional_parameters.description: Source for Gmail's internal date of the message.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optional_parameters.name: neverMarkSpam
optional_parameters.description: Ignore the Gmail spam classifier decision and never mark this email as SPAM in the mailbox.

optional_parameters.name: deleted
optional_parameters.description: Mark the email as permanently deleted (not TRASH) and only visible in Google Vault to a Vault administrator. Only used for G Suite accounts.

optional_parameters.name: processForCalendar
optional_parameters.description: Process calendar invites in the email and add any extracted meetings to the Google Calendar for this user.

api_list.name: insertMessageIntoMailbox
api_list.description: Directly inserts a message into only this user's mailbox similar to IMAP APPEND, bypassing most scanning and classification. Does not send a message.

required_parameters.name: raw
required_parameters.description:
The entire draft message in an RFC 2822 formatted. Example: To: <someone@gmail.com>
Subject: Failure Notice

 Hi. This is the mail transport agent at mail.elsewhere.com.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optional_parameters.name: deleted
optional_parameters.description: Mark the email as permanently deleted (not TRASH) and only visible in Google Vault to a Vault administrator. Only used for G Suite accounts.

optional_parameters.name: internalDateSource
optional_parameters.description: Source for Gmail's internal date of the message.

optional_parameters.name: threadId
optional_parameters.description: Message thread id

optional_parameters.name: labelIds
optional_parameters.description: Only return messages with labels that match all of the specified label IDs.

api_list.name: insertSendAsAliasSMIMEconfig
api_list.description: Insert (upload) the given S/MIME config for the specified send-as alias. Note that pkcs12 format is required for the key.

required_parameters.name: sendAsEmail
required_parameters.description: The send-as alias to be retrieved.

optional_parameters.name: pkcs12
optional_parameters.description: PKCS#12 format containing a single private/public key pair and certificate chain. This format is only accepted from client for creating a new SmimeInfo and is never returned, because the private key is not intended to be exported. PKCS#12 may be encrypted, in which case encryptedKeyPassword should be set appropriately.

optional_parameters.name: isDefault
optional_parameters.description: Whether this SmimeInfo is the default one for this user's send-as address.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optional_parameters.name: encryptedKeyPassword
optional_parameters.description: Encrypted key password, when key is encrypted.

optional_parameters.name: pem
optional_parameters.description: PEM formatted X509 concatenated certificate string (standard base64 encoding). Format used for returning key, which includes public key as well as certificate chain (not private key).

optional_parameters.name: issuerCn
optional_parameters.description: The S/MIME certificate issuer's common name.

required_parameters.name: message
required_parameters.description:
The entire draft message in an RFC 2822 formatted. Example: To: <someone@gmail.com>
Subject: Failure Notice

 Hi. This is the mail transport agent at mail.elsewhere.com.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optional_parameters.name: threadId
optional_parameters.description: Message thread id

api_list.name: sendSimpleMessage

optional_parameters.name: message
optional_parameters.description: Email message

optional_parameters.name: threadId
optional_parameters.description: Message thread id

optional_parameters.name: subject
optional_parameters.description: Email subject

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

api_list.name: setMailboxNotification
api_list.description: Set up or update a push notification watch on the given user mailbox.

required_parameters.name: topicName
required_parameters.description: A fully qualified Google Cloud Pub/Sub API topic name to publish the events to. This topic name **must** already exist in Cloud Pub/Sub and you **must** have already granted gmail "publish" permission on it. For example, "projects/my-project-identifier/topics/my-topic-name" (using the Cloud Pub/Sub "v1" topic naming format).

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optional_parameters.name: labelFilterAction
optional_parameters.description: Filtering behavior of labelIds list specified.

optional_parameters.name: labelIds
optional_parameters.description: List of label_ids to restrict notifications about. By default, if unspecified, all changes are pushed out. If specified then dictates which labels are required for a push notification to be generated.

api_list.name: setSMIMEconfigAsDefault
api_list.description: Sets the default S/MIME config for the specified send-as alias.

required_parameters.name: sendAsEmail
required_parameters.description: The send-as alias to be retrieved.

required_parameters.name: configId
required_parameters.description: The immutable ID for the SmimeInfo.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

api_list.name: stopMailboxNotifications
api_list.description: Stop receiving push notifications for the given user mailbox.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

api_list.name: untrashThread

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

api_list.name: updateAutoForwarding
api_list.description: Updates the auto-forwarding setting for the specified account. A verified forwarding address must be specified when auto-forwarding is enabled.

optional_parameters.name: disposition
optional_parameters.description: The state that a message should be left in after it has been forwarded.

optional_parameters.name: enabled
optional_parameters.description: Whether all incoming mail is automatically forwarded to another address.

optional_parameters.name: emailAddress
optional_parameters.description: Email address to which all incoming messages are forwarded. This email address must be a verified member of the forwarding addresses.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

api_list.name: updateDraft

required_parameters.name: message
required_parameters.description: The entire draft message in an RFC 2822 formatted

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

api_list.name: updateImapSettings

optional_parameters.name: enabled
optional_parameters.description: Whether IMAP is enabled for the account.

optional_parameters.name: expungeBehavior
optional_parameters.description: The action that will be executed on a message when it is marked as deleted and expunged from the last visible IMAP folder.

optional_parameters.name: maxFolderSize
optional_parameters.description: An optional limit on the number of messages that an IMAP folder may contain. Legal values are 0, 1000, 2000, 5000 or 10000. A value of zero is interpreted to mean that there is no limit.

optional_parameters.name: autoExpunge
optional_parameters.description: If this value is true, Gmail will immediately expunge a message when it is marked as deleted in IMAP. Otherwise, Gmail will wait for an update from the client before expunging messages marked as deleted.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

api_list.name: updateLabel

optional_parameters.name: labelListVisibility
optional_parameters.description: The visibility of the label in the label list in the Gmail web interface.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optional_parameters.name: messageListVisibility
optional_parameters.description: The visibility of messages with this label in the message list in the Gmail web interface.

optional_parameters.name: labelName
optional_parameters.description: The display name of the label.

api_list.name: updateLabelsOnMessage

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optional_parameters.name: addLabelIds
optional_parameters.description: Labels to add

optional_parameters.name: removeLabelIds
optional_parameters.description: Labels to remove

api_list.name: updatePopSettings

optional_parameters.name: disposition
optional_parameters.description: The action that will be executed on a message after it has been fetched via POP.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optional_parameters.name: emailAddress
optional_parameters.description: Email address to which all incoming messages are forwarded. This email address must be a verified member of the forwarding addresses.

optional_parameters.name: accessWindow
optional_parameters.description: The range of messages which are accessible via POP.

api_list.name: updateSendAsAlias

required_parameters.name: port
required_parameters.description: The port of the SMTP service.

required_parameters.name: host
required_parameters.description: The hostname of the SMTP service.

required_parameters.name: treatAsAlias
required_parameters.description: Whether Gmail should treat this address as an alias for the user's primary email address. This setting only applies to custom "from" aliases.

required_parameters.name: securityMode
required_parameters.description: The protocol that will be used to secure communication with the SMTP service.

required_parameters.name: sendAsEmail
required_parameters.description: An optional email address that is included in a "Reply-To:" header for mail sent using this alias. If this is empty, Gmail will not generate a "Reply-To:" header.

optional_parameters.name: replyToAddress
optional_parameters.description: An optional email address that is included in a "Reply-To:" header for mail sent using this alias. If this is empty, Gmail will not generate a "Reply-To:" header.

optional_parameters.name: username
optional_parameters.description: The username that will be used for authentication with the SMTP service.

optional_parameters.name: displayName
optional_parameters.description: A name that appears in the "From:" header for mail sent using this alias. For custom "from" addresses, when this is empty, Gmail will populate the "From:" header with the name that is used for the primary address associated with the account.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optional_parameters.name: isDefault
optional_parameters.description: Whether this address is selected as the default

optional_parameters.name: password
optional_parameters.description: The password that will be used for authentication with the SMTP service.

optional_parameters.name: signature
optional_parameters.description: An optional HTML signature that is included in messages composed with this alias in the Gmail web UI.

api_list.name: updateThreadLabels

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optional_parameters.name: addLabelIds
optional_parameters.description: Labels to add

optional_parameters.name: removeLabelIds
optional_parameters.description: Labels to remove

api_list.name: updateVacationSettings

optional_parameters.name: restrictToContacts
optional_parameters.description: Flag that determines whether responses are sent to recipients who are not in the user's list of contacts.

optional_parameters.name: startTime
optional_parameters.description: An optional start time for sending auto-replies (Y-m-d H:m:s). When this is specified, Gmail will automatically reply only to messages that it receives after the start time. If both startTime and endTime are specified, startTime must precede endTime.

optional_parameters.name: enableAutoReply
optional_parameters.description: Flag that controls whether Gmail automatically replies to messages.

optional_parameters.name: responseBodyPlainText
optional_parameters.description: Response body in plain text format.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.

optional_parameters.name: responseBodyHtml
optional_parameters.description: Response body in HTML format. Gmail will sanitize the HTML before storing it.

optional_parameters.name: endTime
optional_parameters.description: An optional end time for sending auto-replies (Y-m-d H:m:s). When this is specified, Gmail will automatically reply only to messages that it receives before the end time. If both startTime and endTime are specified, startTime must precede endTime.

optional_parameters.name: responseSubject
optional_parameters.description: Optional text to prepend to the subject line in vacation responses. In order to enable auto-replies, either the response subject or the response body must be nonempty.

optional_parameters.name: restrictToDomain
optional_parameters.description: Flag that determines whether responses are sent to recipients who are outside of the user's domain. This feature is only available for G Suite users.

api_list.name: verifySendAsAlias

required_parameters.name: sendAsEmail
required_parameters.description: The send-as alias to be retrieved.

optional_parameters.name: email
optional_parameters.description: The email of the user. The special value me can be used to indicate the authenticated user.
